alert.note: Alert for Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Orange; Osceola; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 1:56PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Seminole, northwestern Brevard, southeastern Orange and Osceola Counties through 245 PM EST... At 155 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Union Park to Orlando International Airport to 6 miles south of West Lake Toho. Movement was east northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Saint Cloud, Wedgefield and Bithlo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Orange; Osceola; Seminole
